net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.widget.complex

Class AbstractUiWidgetAbstractDataSet<ADAPTER extends UiWidgetAdapterAbstractDataSet<ITEM>,VALUE,ITEM,ITEM_CONTAINER>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.feature.AbstractUiFeatureValueAndValidation<VALUE>
      • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.widget.AbstractUiWidget<VALUE>
        • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.widget.AbstractUiWidgetNative<ADAPTER,VALUE>
          • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.widget.AbstractUiWidgetActive<ADAPTER,VALUE>
            • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.widget.complex.AbstractUiWidgetAbstractDataSet<ADAPTER,VALUE,ITEM,ITEM_CONTAINER>
  • Type Parameters:
    ADAPTER - is the generic type of AbstractUiWidgetNative.getWidgetAdapter().
    VALUE - is the generic type of the value. Has to be either ITEM or List<ITEM>.
    ITEM - is the generic type of the items contained in this widget.
    ITEM_CONTAINER - is the generic type of the container for the <ITEM> objects. Typically a ItemContainer.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    AttributeReadAccessKey, AttributeReadAriaRole, AttributeReadEditable, AttributeReadEnabled, AttributeReadFocused, AttributeReadHtmlId, AttributeReadMode, AttributeReadModeFixed, AttributeReadModified, AttributeReadPrimaryStyle, AttributeReadSelectedValue<ITEM>, AttributeReadSelectionMode, AttributeReadStringTitle, AttributeReadStyles, AttributeReadStylesAdvanced, AttributeReadSummary, AttributeReadTitleVisible, AttributeReadTooltip, AttributeReadValueAdvanced<VALUE>, AttributeReadVisible, AttributeReadVisibleRecursive, AttributeWriteAccessKey, AttributeWriteAriaRole, AttributeWriteEditable, AttributeWriteEnabled, AttributeWriteFocused, AttributeWriteHtmlId, AttributeWriteMode, AttributeWriteModeFixed, AttributeWriteModified, AttributeWriteOnlyFocused, AttributeWritePrimaryStyle, AttributeWriteSelectedValue<ITEM>, AttributeWriteSelectionMode, AttributeWriteStringTitle, AttributeWriteStyles, AttributeWriteStylesAdvanced, AttributeWriteSummary, AttributeWriteTitleVisible, AttributeWriteTooltip, AttributeWriteValueAdvanced<VALUE>, AttributeWriteVisible, AttributeWriteVisibleAdvanced, UiFeature, UiFeatureEvent, UiFeatureFocus, UiFeatureMessages, UiFeatureMode, UiFeatureSelectedValue<ITEM>, UiFeatureValidation<VALUE>, UiFeatureValue<VALUE>, UiFeatureValueAndValidation<VALUE>, UiWidgetAbstractDataSet<ITEM>, UiWidget, UiWidgetAbstractComposite, UiWidgetAbstractWithValue<VALUE>, UiWidgetActive, UiWidgetRegular, UiWidgetWithSelectedValue<ITEM>, AttributeReadDisposed, AttributeReadId<String>, AttributeReadTitle<String>, AttributeReadValue<VALUE>, AttributeWriteDisposed, AttributeWriteId<String>, AttributeWriteTitle<String>, AttributeWriteValue<VALUE>, Accessibility, AbstractValidatableObject, HasValueValidators<VALUE>, ValidatableObject<VALUE>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractUiWidgetAbstractDataTable, AbstractUiWidgetTree

    public abstract class AbstractUiWidgetAbstractDataSet<ADAPTER extends UiWidgetAdapterAbstractDataSet<ITEM>,VALUE,ITEM,ITEM_CONTAINER>
extends AbstractUiWidgetActive<ADAPTER,VALUE>
implements UiWidgetAbstractDataSet<ITEM>
    This is the abstract base implementation of UiWidgetAbstractListTable.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

      • isTitleVisible

        public boolean isTitleVisible()
        This method determines if the title of this object is visible. For Accessibility reasons you should always set the title of a titled object. However in specific cases you want to save space on the screen and may not require the title to be displayed for seeing users. Then you can hide the title while it is still recognized by assistive technology such as screen readers.
        Specified by:
        isTitleVisible in interface AttributeReadTitleVisible
        Returns:
        true if visible, false if hidden.

      • setTitleVisible

        public void setTitleVisible(boolean titleVisible)
        This method sets the titleVisible flag of this object.
        Specified by:
        setTitleVisible in interface AttributeWriteTitleVisible
        Parameters:
        titleVisible - is the new value for AttributeReadTitleVisible.isTitleVisible().

      • isEditable

        public boolean isEditable()
        This method gets the editable status of this object. Editable means that the end-user can edit the data of the object if also in edit mode (e.g. a data table that allows inline editing). If the editable feature is turned off, the user can no longer edit the data.
        This is closely related to AttributeReadEnabled.isEnabled(). However turning off the editable-flag is weaker than disabling a UI object. An enabled but NOT editable object may still allow user-interaction (e.g. a combobox that still allows selection out of a predefined list but no editing of the text). Further the visualization is softer (no grey out of the entire object).
        ATTENTION:
        There may be other aspects that have influence if the user can currently edit this object such as the mode or enabled flag. This method only returns the editable flag (as set via AttributeWriteEditable.setEditable(boolean)) and therefore only tells if the object is potentially editable.
        Specified by:
        isEditable in interface AttributeReadEditable
        Returns:
        true if this object is editable, false otherwise.

      • setEditable

        public void setEditable(boolean editableFlag)
        This method set the editable status.
        Specified by:
        setEditable in interface AttributeWriteEditable
        Parameters:
        editableFlag - if true the object will become editable, if false the object will become un-editable.

      • setSelectionMode

        public void setSelectionMode(SelectionMode selectionMode)
        This method sets the selection mode.
        ATTENTION:
        It is recommended to set the SelectionMode immediately after creating the object. The initial default is always SelectionMode.SINGLE_SELECTION. Dynamically changing the SelectionMode may be expensive or not be supported (in exotic implementations) and should therefore be avoided.
        Specified by:
        setSelectionMode in interface AttributeWriteSelectionMode
        Parameters:
        selectionMode - is the new SelectionMode.

      • setSelectedValue

        public boolean setSelectedValue(ITEM selectedValue)
        This method sets the value currently selected. If the given value is NOT available, the method will have NO effect. Otherwise this method will deselect all currently selected values and select the given value.
        Specified by:
        setSelectedValue in interface AttributeWriteSelectedValue<ITEM>
        Parameters:
        selectedValue - is the value to select.
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful, false otherwise (the given selectedValue is not contained in this object and cannot be selected).

      • setSelectedValues

        public boolean setSelectedValues(Collection<ITEM> selectedItems)
        This method sets the values currently selected. All values that are NOT available, will be ignored.
        ATTENTION:
        In case of SelectionMode.SINGLE_SELECTION you shall not provide a Collection with more than one element. So you should then use AttributeWriteSelectedValue.setSelectedValue(Object) instead.
        Further, if you call AttributeReadSelectedValue.getSelectedValues() after this method the items may be in a different order. Additionally the result of AttributeReadSelectedValue.getSelectedValue() will contain elements that are actually items available in this object. So e.g. if you have a list of items and call this method to select two items but only one of them is actually available in the list, then only that one is selected and therefore returned by AttributeReadSelectedValue.getSelectedValues().
        Specified by:
        setSelectedValues in interface AttributeWriteSelectedValue<ITEM>
        Parameters:
        selectedItems - is the Collection with the values to select.
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful and all selectedValues have been selected, false otherwise (at least one item out of selectedValues is not contained in this object and cannot be selected).

      • setSelectedValues

        public boolean setSelectedValues(Collection<ITEM> selectedItems,
                                 boolean programmatic)
        Parameters:
        selectedItems - is the Collection with the values to select.
        programmatic - - see UiEvent.isProgrammatic().
        Returns:
        see setSelectedValues(Collection).
        See Also:
        setSelectedValues(Collection)

      • setSelection

        public boolean setSelection(SelectionChoice choice,
                            SelectionOperation operation)
        This method allows to change the selection of a logical SelectionChoice in a generic way. The following table shows the combinations and their effect:
        choice operation setSelection(choice, operation) multi selection only
        SelectionChoice.ALL SelectionOperation.SET selects all items. yes
        SelectionChoice.ALL SelectionOperation.ADD same effect as above. yes
        SelectionChoice.ALL SelectionOperation.REMOVE de-selects all items so none is selected. yes
        SelectionChoice.ALL SelectionOperation.TOGGLE toggles the selection of all items so the selection gets inverted. yes
        SelectionChoice.FIRST SelectionOperation.SET clears the selection and then selects the first item. no
        SelectionChoice.FIRST SelectionOperation.ADD Adds the first item to the current selection. yes
        SelectionChoice.FIRST SelectionOperation.REMOVE Removes the first item from the current selection. no
        SelectionChoice.FIRST SelectionOperation.TOGGLE Toggles the selection of the first item. no
        SelectionChoice.LAST SelectionOperation.SET clears the selection and then selects the last item. no
        SelectionChoice.LAST SelectionOperation.ADD Adds the last item to the current selection. yes
        SelectionChoice.LAST SelectionOperation.REMOVE Removes the last item from the current selection. no
        SelectionChoice.LAST SelectionOperation.TOGGLE Toggles the selection of the last item. no
        Specified by:
        setSelection in interface UiFeatureSelectedValue<ITEM>
        Parameters:
        choice - is the SelectionChoice indicating the items to select or deselect.
        operation - is the SelectionOperation indicating what to do with the choice.
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful, false otherwise. If there are no items at all true is returned in case of SelectionChoice.ALL and false otherwise.

      • clearSelection

        protected void clearSelection(ITEM_CONTAINER exclusion)
        Clears the current selection except for the given exclusion.
        Parameters:
        exclusion - is the itemContainer to exclude (keep its selection untouched) or null for no exclusion.

      • isSelected

        public boolean isSelected(SelectionChoice choice)
        This method determines if the given logical SelectionChoice is currently selected.
        Specified by:
        isSelected in interface UiFeatureSelectedValue<ITEM>
        Parameters:
        choice - is the SelectionChoice to check.
        Returns:
        true if the items identified by the given choice are currently selected, false otherwise (if at least one of them is NOT selected).

      • setSelection

        protected boolean setSelection(ITEM_CONTAINER itemContainer,
                               SelectionOperation operation)
        Updates the selection of the given itemContainer according to the given operation.
        Parameters:
        itemContainer - is the container with the item to update.
        operation - is the SelectionOperation to perform.
        Returns:
        the new selection state of the itemContainer.

                            boolean selected,
                            boolean programmatic)
        Called from adapter if an item (<ITEM>) has been (de)selected.
        Parameters:

      • doGetSelected

        protected boolean doGetSelected(ITEM_CONTAINER container)
        Internal method to get the selection status of the item in the given container.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if the item is selected, false otherwise.

      • doSetSelected

        protected abstract void doSetSelected(ITEM_CONTAINER container,
                                      boolean selected)
        Internal method to set the selection of the item in the given container. Shall not do anything else (e.g. firing event).
        Parameters:
        container - is the container with the item to mark.
        selected - - true to select, false to deselect.

      • getAllAvailableItems

        public abstract Collection<ITEM_CONTAINER> getAllAvailableItems()
        Internal method to get the Collection with all items (currently) available in this widget. In case of lazy loading only those that have already been loaded.
        ATTENTION:
        The Collection must NOT be modified if retrieved via this method. Implementations will provide separate addItem and removeItem methods.
        Returns:
        the Collection with all items (currently) available in this widget. In case of lazy loading only those that have already been loaded.

      • getFirstAvailableItem

        protected ITEM_CONTAINER getFirstAvailableItem()
        Returns:
        the first of the available items.

      • getLastAvailableItem

        protected abstract ITEM_CONTAINER getLastAvailableItem()
        Returns:
        the last of the available items.

      • getItemContainer

        protected abstract ITEM_CONTAINER getItemContainer(ITEM item)
        Gets the existing container for the given item. This method has to be very efficient. You should use a Map for this purpose.
        Parameters:
        item - is the item to lookup.
        Returns:
        the container for the given item or null if no such container exists.

      • getItem

        protected abstract ITEM getItem(ITEM_CONTAINER container)
        This method gets the item in the given container.
        Parameters:
        container - is the container of the requested item.
        Returns:
        the unwrapped item.
